bill_title: repeal and revise certain provisions relating to mandatory consecutive sentences.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to repeal and revise certain provisions relating to mandatory consecutive sentences. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 23A-27-36 be repealed. 23A-27-36. If any prisoner commits a crime, upon conviction, the sentence of the prisoner shall not commence to run until the expiration of the last sentence of his imprisonment. The term "prisoner" as used in this section includes every person in custody, under arrest, or under process of law issued from a court of competent jurisdiction. Section 2. That § 22-11A-2 be amended to read as follows: 22-11A-2. Any prisoner who escapes is guilty of a Class 4 felony. If such prisoner is under sentence of imprisonment, his sentence on conviction for an escape shall commence following the expiration of the term of the last sentence of his imprisonment. Section 3. That § 24-15A-20 be amended to read as follows: 24-15A-20. Any If a person is convicted of a felony while an inmate under the custody of the warden of the penitentiary and for which , the sentence is made to shall run consecutively and the person is not eligible for consideration for parole until serving the last of all such consecutive sentences , unless the sentencing court specifically orders otherwise . In such cases the The parole date shall be established subject to the provisions of § 24-15A-32. Section 4. That § 24-15-7.1 be amended to read as follows: 24-15-7.1. Any If a person is convicted of a felony while an inmate under the custody of the warden of the penitentiary and for which , the sentence is made to shall run consecutively and the person is not eligible for consideration for parole until serving the last of all such consecutive sentences , unless the sentencing court specifically orders otherwise . In such cases the The initial parole consideration eligibility date shall be established subject to the provisions of subdivisions 24-15-5(2) and (3). Section 5. That § 22-18-27 be amended to read as follows: 22-18-27. A penitentiary sentence arising from a conviction pursuant to § 22-18-26 may not commence until the expiration, with no allowance of good time, of the last sentence of imprisonment , pursuant to § 23A-27-36 . Section 6. That § 22-11A-9 be amended to read as follows: 22-11A-9. A penitentiary sentence arising from a conviction under § 22-11A-8 may not commence until the expiration, with no allowance of good time, of the last sentence of imprisonment , pursuant to § 23A-27-36 .

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to repeal and revise certain provisions relating to mandatory consecutive sentences. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 23A-27-36 be repealed. 23A-27-36. If any prisoner commits a crime, upon conviction, the sentence of the prisoner shall not commence to run until the expiration of the last sentence of his imprisonment. The term "prisoner" as used in this section includes every person in custody, under arrest, or under process of law issued from a court of competent jurisdiction. Section 2. That § 22-11A-2 be amended to read as follows: 22-11A-2. Any prisoner who escapes is guilty of a Class 4 felony. If such prisoner is under sentence of imprisonment, his sentence on conviction for an escape shall commence following the expiration of the term of the last sentence of his imprisonment. Section 3. That § 24-15A-20 be amended to read as follows: 24-15A-20. Any If a person is convicted of a felony while an inmate under the custody of the warden of the penitentiary and for which , the sentence is made to shall run consecutively and the person is not eligible for consideration for parole until serving the last of all such consecutive sentences , unless the sentencing court specifically orders otherwise . In such cases the The parole date shall be established subject to the provisions of § 24-15A-32. This section does not apply to a person who commits a felony while on parole as defined in § 24-15A-15. Section 4. That § 22-18-27 be amended to read as follows: 22-18-27. A penitentiary sentence arising from a conviction pursuant to § 22-18-26 may not commence until the expiration, with no allowance of good time, of the last sentence of imprisonment , pursuant to § 23A-27-36 . Section 5. That § 22-11A-9 be amended to read as follows: 22-11A-9. A penitentiary sentence arising from a conviction under § 22-11A-8 may not commence until the expiration, with no allowance of good time, of the last sentence of imprisonment , pursuant to § 23A-27-36 .

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to repeal and revise certain provisions relating to mandatory consecutive sentences. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 23A-27-36 be repealed. 23A-27-36. If any prisoner commits a crime, upon conviction, the sentence of the prisoner shall not commence to run until the expiration of the last sentence of his imprisonment. The term "prisoner" as used in this section includes every person in custody, under arrest, or under process of law issued from a court of competent jurisdiction. Section 2. That § 22-11A-2 be amended to read as follows: 22-11A-2. Any prisoner who escapes is guilty of a Class 4 felony. If such prisoner is under sentence of imprisonment, his sentence on conviction for an escape shall commence following the expiration of the term of the last sentence of his imprisonment. Section 3. That § 24-15A-20 be amended to read as follows: 24-15A-20. Any If a person is convicted of a felony while an inmate under the custody of the warden of the penitentiary and for which , the sentence is made to shall run consecutively and the person is not eligible for consideration for parole until serving the last of all such consecutive sentences , unless the sentencing court specifically orders otherwise . In such cases the The parole date shall be established subject to the provisions of § 24-15A-32. This section does not apply to a person who commits a felony while on parole as defined in § 24-15A-15. Section 4. That § 22-18-27 be amended to read as follows: 22-18-27. A penitentiary sentence arising from a conviction pursuant to § 22-18-26 may not commence until the expiration, with no allowance of good time, of the last sentence of imprisonment , pursuant to § 23A-27-36 . Section 5. That § 22-11A-9 be amended to read as follows: 22-11A-9. A penitentiary sentence arising from a conviction under § 22-11A-8 may not commence until the expiration, with no allowance of good time, of the last sentence of imprisonment , pursuant to § 23A-27-36 . Section 6. That chapter 23A-27 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If a person is convicted of a crime committed while confined in a county or municipal jail, upon conviction, the sentence does not commence to run until the expiration of the last sentence of imprisonment, unless the sentencing court specifically orders otherwise.
